arm_group.description: First Etoricoxib Prescription, Apr. 1, 2002 to Feb. 17, 2005
First Etoricoxib Prescription, Feb. 18, 2005 to Dec. 31, 2015
One prescription during the Period 1 and, at least, one etoricoxib prescription during Period 2.

brief_summary.textblock:
This postmarketing study was conducted to describe prescribing patterns for etoricoxib
      (ARCOXIA®) in General Practice and describe the incidence of selected adverse events
      recorded in the United Kingdom (UK) Medicines and Health Care Products Regulatory Agency
      (MHRA) General Practice Research Database (GPRD).

clinical_study.brief_title: Etoricoxib Prescribing Patterns and Adverse Events of Interest in Primary Care in the United Kingdom (MK-0663-162 AM1)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients in the MHRA's Full Feature GPRD (FF-GPRD) who have at least one
             electronic outpatient prescription record for etoricoxib issued by a General
             Practitioner during the period (April 1, 2002 to December 31, 2015) at the date of
             query execution against the FF-GPRD data warehouse.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Not registered in a GPRD-contributing practice that had continuously

        collected data deemed to be 'up-to-standard' for research purposes from 1 April 2002
        through to 31 December 2015.

          -  Never registered as a permanent patient of a General Practitioner in the practice

          -  Registration details were not acceptable (i.e. incomplete data or logically
             implausible dates)

          -  Not registered with a General Practitioner for at least 365 days before the date that
             the patient's first etoricoxib prescription was recorded in the GPRD

study_pop.textblock:
All participants in the MHRA's Full Feature GPRD (FF-GPRD) who have at least one
        electronic outpatient prescription record for etoricoxib issued by a General Practitioner
        during the period (April 1, 2002 to December 31, 2015) at the date of query execution
        against the FF-GPRD data warehouse.

intervention.description: As per routine clinical practice in the United Kingdom

clinical_study.official_title: Etoricoxib Prescribing Patterns and Adverse Events of Interest During Etoricoxib Treatment in UK Primary Care; an Updated Analysis
